definition[0]: a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc
definition[1]: a long narrow area of land
example[1]: A strip of sand between the cliffs and the sea.
definition[2]: a road with a lot of shops, restaurants etc along it
definition[3]: the clothes worn by a sports team
definition[5]: to take off your clothes or take off someone else’s clothes
example[4]: Jack stripped and jumped into the shower.
example[5]: The prisoner was stripped and beaten.
example[6]: Eric stood in the hot sun, stripped to the waist (=not wearing any clothes on the top half of his body).
example[7]: Terry stripped down to her bra and pants  (=removed all her clothes except her bra and pants) and tried on the dress.
example[8]: The boys stripped naked and jumped in the pond.
example[9]: He stripped off his sweater and threw it onto the couch.
definition[6]: to take off your clothes in a sexually exciting way as entertainment for someone else
definition[7]: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
example[10]: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
example[11]: We need to strip the wallpaper off the walls first.
definition[8]: to separate an engine or piece of equipment into pieces in order to clean or repair it
definition[9]: to remove everything that is inside a building, all the equipment from a car etc so that it is completely empty
example[13]: The apartment had been stripped bare.
definition[10]: to damage or break the gears of something or the thread (=raised line) on a screw so that it does not work correctly anymore
definition[11]: a SECURITY that has been created by separating a bond into the right to interest payments and the right to the repayment of the PRINCIPAL (=the original capital amount). For example, a 30-year bond would create 61 strips, 60 giving the right to receive interest payments every six months and one giving the right to have the capital repaid after 30 years
example[14]: The principal strips yield 8.25% in 2009, and the interest strips mature in February and August of each year.
definition[12]: an OPTION contract consisting of two PUT OPTIONs and one CALL OPTION on the same shares and with the same price and date
definition[13]: to separate a bond into strips
example[15]: When a bond is stripped, its corpus, or principal due upon maturity, is sold separately without interest payments.
